00009 void flushBuffer(void)
00010 {
00011   int c;
00012 
00013   while ((c = getchar()) != '\n' && c != EOF)
00014     continue;
00015 }
00016 
00017 int readChar(char* c) {
00018   char input[2+1];
00019 
00020   /* We read n+1 from the input to be able to check
00021    * if the user has written exactly n characters */
00022   readValue(input, 2);
00023 
00024   if (strlen(input) != 1)
00025     return 1;
00026   else {
00027     *c = input[0];
00028     return 0;
00029   }
00030 }

00032 int readData(artwork_info *info)
00033 {
00034   /* We use IMG_LENGTH-2 here because we exclude the first
00035    * two characters in the identifier (the group number)
00036    * since it's constant.
00037    */
00038   char img[ (IMG_LENGTH-2)+1 ];
00039 
00040   /* Returns an error if the pointer is NULL. */
00041   if (!info)
00042     return 1;
00043 
00044   readString("\n   Por favor, digite o titulo da obra (Max: 200 caracteres): ",
00045              info->title, TITLE_LENGTH);
00046   readString("   Por favor, digite o tipo da obra (Max: 100 caracteres): ",
00047              info->type, TYPE_LENGTH);
00048   readString("   Por favor, digite o autor da obra (Max: 125 caracteres): ",
00049              info->author, AUTHOR_LENGTH);
00050 
00051   readInt("   Por favor, digite o ano da obra (Max: 4 caracteres): ",
00052           info->year, YEAR_LENGTH);
00053   readInt("   Por favor, digite o valor da obra (Max: 12 caracteres): ",
00054           info->value, VALUE_LENGTH);
00055 
00056   while (1) {
00057     readString("   Por favor, digite o identificador da obra (Max: 7 caracteres): ",
00058                img, IMG_LENGTH-2);
00059 
00060     /* Validate the image identifier */
00061     if (!baseIsValidIdentifier(img)) {
00062       strncpy(info->img, GROUP_NUMBER, 2);
00063       strncpy(info->img+2, img, (IMG_LENGTH-2)+1);
00064       break;
00065     }
00066     else {
00067       printf("   Entrada invalida.");
00068       continue;
00069     }
00070   }
00071 
00072   return 0;
00073 }
00074 
00075 /* This is basically a wrapper around readString
00076  * which checks if there are only digits in the
00077  * string read and loops back if not.
00078  */
00079 void readInt(const char* inputText, char* dest, size_t length)
00080 {
00081   int i, invalid;
00082 
00083   invalid = 1;
00084 
00085   while (invalid) {
00086     readString(inputText, dest, length);
00087 
00088     for (i = 0; i < strlen(dest); i++) {
00089       if (!isdigit(dest[i])) {
00090         printf("Entrada invalida.\n");
00091         invalid = 1;
00092         break;
00093       }
00094     }
00095 
00096     invalid = 0;
00097   }
00098 }
00099 
00100 void readString(const char* inputText, char* dest, size_t length)
00101 {
00102   while (1) {
00103     printf(inputText);
00104     readValue(dest, length);
00105 
00106     if (strlen(dest) == 0) {
00107       printf("   Entrada invalida.");
00108       continue;
00109     } else
00110       break;
00111   }
00112 }
00113 
00114 void readValue(char s[], size_t length)
00115 {
00116   fgets(s, length+1, stdin);
00117 
00118   stripNewLine(s);
00119   stripWhiteSpace(s);
00120 }
00121 
00122 void stripNewLine(char s[])
00123 {
00124   char* pos = strchr(s, '\n');
00125 
00126   if (!pos)
00127     flushBuffer();
00128   else
00129     *pos = '\0';
00130 }
00131 
00132 void stripWhiteSpace(char str[]) {
00133   int i, j, pos;
00134   int len;
00135   int space; /* Flag used to indicate if a space has already been immediately read */
00136   char* buffer;
00137 
00138   /* We cannot allocate memory for 0 bytes, so
00139    * we abort the function
00140    */
00141   len = strlen(str);
00142   if (len < 1)
00143     return;
00144 
00145   buffer = (char*)calloc(len, sizeof(char));
00146   if (buffer) {
00147     /* Skip whitespace at the beginning */
00148     for (i = 0; i < len && isspace(str[i]); i++);
00149 
00150     /* Skip whitespace at the end */
00151     for (j = len-1; j > i && isspace(str[j]); j--);
00152 
00153     pos = 0; space = 0;
00154     for (; i <= j; i++) {
00155       /* If this is the first whitespace we see,
00156        * add it to the final string and trigger
00157        * our whitespace-already-seen flag.
00158        */
00159       if (isspace(str[i]) && !space) {
00160         buffer[pos++] = str[i];
00161         space = 1;
00162       }
00163       /* If this is not a whitespace, copy
00164        * the character to the final string and
00165        * disable our whitespace-already-seen flag.
00166        */
00167       else if (!isspace(str[i])) {
00168         buffer[pos++] = str[i];
00169         space = 0;
00170       }
00171     }
00172 
00173     /* Replace the original string with the manipulated one. */
00174     strncpy(str, buffer, pos);
00175     str[pos] = '\0';
00176 
00177     free(buffer);
00178   }
00179 }
